\LoggerOptionConverter

A convenience class to convert property values to specific types.

Tags

version

$Revision: 1374617 $
since 0.5

Properties

$trueValues

$trueValues :

String values which are converted to boolean TRUE.

Type

Tags

None found

$falseValues

$falseValues :

String values which are converted to boolean FALSE.

Note that an empty string must convert to false, because parse_ini_file() which is used for parsing configuration converts the value false to an empty string.

Type

Tags

None found

Methods

getSystemProperty()

getSystemProperty(string  $key, string  $def) : string

Read a predefined var.

It returns a value referenced by $key using this search criteria:

  • if $key is a constant then return it. Else
  • if $key is set in $_ENV then return it. Else
  • return $def.

Parameters

string $key

The key to search for.
string $def

The default value to return.

Returns

string —

the string value of the system property, or the default value if there is no property with that key.

toFileSizeEx()

toFileSizeEx(mixed  $value) : integer

Converts a value to a valid file size (integer).

Supports 'KB', 'MB' and 'GB' suffixes, where KB = 1024 B etc.

The final value will be rounded to the nearest integer.

Examples:

  • '100' => 100
  • '100.12' => 100
  • '100KB' => 102400
  • '1.5MB' => 1572864

Parameters

mixed $value

File size (optionally with suffix).

toStringEx()

Converts a value to string, or throws an exception if not possible.

Objects can be converted to string if they implement the magic __toString() method.

substConstants()

substConstants(string  $string) : string

Performs value substitution for string options.

An option can contain PHP constants delimited by '${' and '}'.

E.g. for input string "some ${FOO} value", the method will attempt to substitute ${FOO} with the value of constant FOO if it exists.

Therefore, if FOO is a constant, and it has value "bar", the resulting string will be "some bar value".

If the constant is not defined, it will be replaced by an empty string, and the resulting string will be "some value".

Parameters

string $string

String on which to perform substitution.
Warning: count(): Parameter must be an array or an object that implements Countable in /opt/phpdoc/vendor/twig/twig/lib/Twig/Extension/Core.php on line 1275 Warning: count(): Parameter must be an array or an object that implements Countable in /opt/phpdoc/vendor/twig/twig/lib/Twig/Extension/Core.php on line 1275
